Data: Broad to Haddin, 1 run Broad swings it towards middle and leg, Haddin flicks it away through square
Broad to Johnson, no run full and just outside off, Johnson drives to mid-off
Broad to Johnson, no run probing outside off again and Johnson shoulders arms
Broad to Johnson, no run bouncer this time and Johnson ducks underneath it
Broad to Johnson, no run another bouncer from Broad, he's trying to get on top of Johnson here, but the batsman ducks it safely
Broad to Johnson, 1 run full and straight, Johnson clips it through square leg and picks up another run, they're few and far between for him at the moment
Swann to Johnson, no run tossed up on the stumps and Johnson leans forward to defend
Swann to Johnson, no run brings the length back a bit and Johnson drives to short cover
Swann to Johnson, no run shorter now, Johnson goes back into his crease and punches to cover

Swann to Johnson, SIX runs well now, it might only be a few minutes until tea, but Johnson has decided he's had enough of pushing and prodding, he launches this one high and long over long-on, really gets under it and that sails ten rows back into the crowd
Swann to Johnson, no run on the back foot and pushed to mid-off
Swann to Johnson, 2 runs flatter and on the pads, Johnson works this one to fine leg
Root to Haddin, no run Root is around the wicket and Haddin defends from leg stump
Root to Haddin, no run tossed up and full, Haddin defends
Root to Haddin, no run plenty of flight here but not much turn, he defends
Root to Haddin, no run angling across the stumps from around the wicket, Haddin pushes to mid off
Root to Haddin, no run solidly defended from back in the crease
Root to Haddin, no run defended safely again
Swann to Johnson, no run tossed up and patted defensively back down the track
Swann to Johnson, no run round the wicket, gives this a bit of air and Johnson leans out and punches towards mid-off
Swann to Johnson, no run gets on top of the bounce and steers the ball into the covers
Swann to Haddin, no run floated up in the channel outside off, blocked coming forwards
Swann to Haddin, no run stays in the crease and pushes the ball back wide of the bowler, Swann chases it down
Anderson to Johnson, no run slightly back of a length, pushed across and defended on the back foot
Anderson to Johnson, 1 run on the pads, Johnson nurdles one through square leg
Anderson to Haddin, no run good length, shaping back in from outside off, Haddin comes forward to straight bat it in defence
Anderson to Haddin, 2 runs stands up to lace a drive through a gap in the covers for a couple

Anderson to Haddin, SIX runs that'll have Anderson muttering to himself, too, dragging the ball down and encouraging Haddin to swat the ball over deep square leg, just a pirouette and a flick but the ball comes right out of the middle and sails over the rope
Anderson to Haddin, no run beats him, Anderson zings one past the outside edge as Haddin gropes in the channel - good response
Swann to Johnson, no run flat and outside off stump, left alone
Swann to Johnson, 2 runs floated up, Johnson gets on the front foot and drives a couple more through the covers
Swann to Johnson, no run straightening outside off, comes forward to defend
Swann to Johnson, no run angled in, again Johnson remains circumspect
Swann to Johnson, no run drops back in the crease and pats a length ball into the leg side
Swann to Johnson, no run tossed up nice and high, big waft from Johnson, who powers a drive straight to mid-off
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run short ball again to Haddin, who works it through midwicket off the back foot
Anderson to Johnson, no run rapped on the knee roll, Anderson half goes up as the ball holds its line and beats Johnson on the inside, probably pitched outside leg, though
Anderson to Johnson, no run gets on the front foot, inside edge on to the pads
Anderson to Johnson, no run pushed across the left-hander, who steers a length delivery towards point
Anderson to Johnson, no run solid blocking from Mitch, who present the face of the bat in defence again
Anderson to Johnson, no run nips one through the defences again, hit on the thigh pad, I think, and again Anderson stifles his appeal
Swann to Haddin, no run tossed up from round the wicket, pushed back into the on side
Swann to Haddin, no run presses forward to a ball on the stumps and a low inside edge rolls towards the close catcher
Swann to Haddin, no run off-stump line, defended
Swann to Haddin, no run on the stumps, Haddin leans forward to defend again
Swann to Haddin, no run tossed up, middle and leg stump, blocked with a straight bat
Swann to Haddin, no run full and flighted, defended from the crease by Haddin, no problemo yessireebob
Anderson to Johnson, 1 run shuffles across the stumps and tucks one off the pads through backward square
Anderson to Haddin, no run length delivery, shaping in a touch from outside off, phlegmatic defence from Haddin
Anderson to Haddin, no run gets across and defends in front of the stumps
Anderson to Haddin, no run wide of the stumps, nice straight bat from Haddin, who chops into the covers
Anderson to Haddin, no run Anderson continues to perform a thorough frisking of the channel outside off, Haddin blocks again
Anderson to Haddin, no run touch short, Haddin gets outside off and taps into the off side
Swann to Johnson, no run floated up outside the line of off, straightening a little and defended coming forwards
Swann to Johnson, no run goes back this time and blocks a length ball

Swann to Johnson, FOUR runs Johnson rocks back to play a forceful back-foot drive, it shouldn't bring him anything but Joe Root misjudges his long barrier and the ball skitters away to the boundary for four
Swann to Johnson, 1 run more runs for Johnson, who gets forward and works the ball wide of mid-on
Swann to Haddin, no run over the wicket now, Haddin leans out and defends
Swann to Haddin, no run spinning in and played with the turn to midwicket
Anderson to Johnson, 1 run Johnson goes across his crease and flicks another single to leg
Anderson to Haddin, no run good pace and carry from Anderson, the ball steaming through in the corridor as Haddin leaves
Anderson to Haddin, no run not sure which side was rough/shiny on this delivery but the ball slithers past the outside edge and through to Prior
Anderson to Haddin, FOUR runs short and wide and Haddin cashes in, thrashing a cut shot past backward point for four
Anderson to Haddin, no run slightly short, defended from the crease
Anderson to Haddin, no run Haddin hops back and across and defends outside off
Swann to Johnson, no run round the wicket to MJ, tossed up and pushed into the covers on the front foot
Swann to Johnson, no run Johnson cabs across outside off, pats the ball back with a straight bat
Swann to Johnson, no run full and flighted, Johnson unleashes a back-foot thwack but picks out the man cover
Swann to Johnson, no run tossed up, comes forward and drives into the off side
Swann to Johnson, no run leg-stump line, leans out and gets an inside edge on to pad
Swann to Johnson, no run on the stumps, Johnson watchfully taps back to the bowler - maiden for Swann
Tremlett to Haddin, 1 run short and at the body, Haddin stays back and nudges one behind square on the leg side
Tremlett to Johnson, no run touch back of a length and fired across the bows, Johnson attempts an airy thrash and luckily fails to connect
Tremlett to Johnson, no run short and wide and cut into the ground, thick bottom edge
Tremlett to Johnson, no run Tremlett slips in the full-bunger, outside off stump but Johnson gets his bat down on it
Tremlett to Johnson, 1 run short and on the hips, Johnson pings a closed-face nurdle through midwicket
Tremlett to Haddin, no run tight line around off stump from Tremlett, who has done what England wanted today. Haddin defends from the crease
Swann to Johnson, no run floated up outside off stump, driven into the covers coming forwards
Swann to Johnson, no run punched back to Swann's left, he dives to ground but unsuccessfully, nearly rolling under Brad Haddin in the process
Swann to Johnson, no run dragged the length down, Johnson frees the arms and cracks another four iron straight to cover
Swann to Johnson, no run slides this through in the channel outside off, left alone
Swann to Johnson, no run bit of extra bounce outside off as Johnson leaves
Swann to Johnson, no run tossed up on off stump, spins and straightens and Johnson defends down the track
Tremlett to Haddin, no run pitched up around the line of off, defended
Tremlett to Haddin, no run tempting length from Tremlett, not quite there to drive and Haddin duly doesn't, stepping out and ushering the ball through
Tremlett to Haddin, no run Haddin has a dash, horizontal bat in the channel, Tremlett's bounce takes the ball whistling past the edge and into Prior's gloves as the batsman reproaches himself
Tremlett to Haddin, no run length delivery, outside off, gets across to defend
Tremlett to Haddin, no run slightly full and in the corridor, driven towards mid-off
Tremlett to Haddin, 1 run straighter line, Haddin works across the line and they pick up a single into a gap at midwicket
Swann to Haddin, 1 run outside off, driven towards mid-off and a fumble gives them one
Swann to Johnson, no run floated up and driven into the off side
Swann to Johnson, no run Swann gives this some air, again Johnson punches back down the pitch
Swann to Johnson, no run fired in fuller and quicker, jams the bat down
Swann to Johnson, 3 runs Swann drops short and this is clipped neatly behind square off the back foot - that's the fifty partnership up between these two
Tremlett to Johnson, no run angled across on a good length, played towards cover
Tremlett to Johnson, 2 runs short and at the batsman, who rolls the arms through a controlled pull shot out towards deep midwicket
Tremlett to Johnson, no run sliding across, back of a length and let go outside off
Tremlett to Johnson, no run angled outside off again from Tremlett, steered square
Tremlett to Johnson, no run tight line and length, Johnson maintains his discipline and gets behind a defensive prod
Tremlett to Johnson, no run in the channel, wide enough for Johnson to shoulder arms and watch the ball through
Swann to Haddin, no run round the wicket, tossed up and punched back on the full around leg stump
Swann to Haddin, no run turned towards midwicket
Swann to Haddin, no run flatter, on the stumps, Haddin tucks the ball into the leg with a closed bat face
Swann to Haddin, no run floated up on the stumps, more watchful stonewalling from Australia's wicketkeeper
Swann to Haddin, no run flighted, on the stumps, Haddin chops into the ground back to Swann
Swann to Haddin, 1 run gets on the front foot and pushes the ball back past the bowler to long-on
Broad to Haddin, no run touch short, outside off, played on the back foot towards cover
Broad to Haddin, 1 run full and slightly wide of the stumps, driven fiercely back down the pitch and Broad does a little evasion dance, the ball hitting his heels and rolling toward midwicket
Broad to Johnson, no run sliding across in the channel outside off, Johnson blocks once more
Broad to Johnson, 1 run worked off the pads, wide of mid-on and deep midwicket comes running in to keep them to a single
Broad to Haddin, no run pitched up around off stump, Haddin drives on the walks and Broad fields in his follow through
Broad to Haddin, 1 run dug in short, Haddin paddles a flat pull shot down to long leg for one more
Swann to Haddin, no run goes over the wicket now to the right-hander, who defends into the off side
Swann to Haddin, no run flighted, outside off, doesn't quite get to the pitch and Haddin's drive bobbles to mid-off
Swann to Haddin, no run slightly short, spinning in slowly, covered up in defence
Swann to Haddin, 1 run floated up on off stump, Haddin steps across and taps a single to long-on
Swann to Johnson, no run round the wicket, Johnson leans into a defensive push
Broad to Haddin, no run on the stumps, Haddin gets across to block
Broad to Haddin, no run slightly short of a good length, outside off stump, played from the crease towards point
Broad to Haddin, 1 run drops the ball short again, doesn't get up all that much and Haddin swats one wide of long leg with a roll of the wrists

Broad to Johnson, no run Broad goes round the wicket, bounces Johnson again, who tries to ramp the ball over the keeper, may having been a touch slow and he's nowhere near connecting as it loops through
Broad to Johnson, 1 run fired in towards the body, worked to leg for another single
Broad to Haddin, no run back over the wicket, length ball shaping back and past the off peg as Haddin leaves
Swann to Johnson, no run tossed up and played back down the track
Swann to Johnson, no run tight on off stump, Johnson leans forward studiously and blocks
Swann to Johnson, no run Swann spears in a much quicker ball and almost succeeds in yorking Johnson, who does well to keep it out
Swann to Johnson, no run flat and outside off, lets this one through
Swann to Johnson, FOUR runs stand and deliver from Johnson, who watches the ball under his eyeline and then clatters Swann through mid-off to the boundary. That stayed hit
Swann to Johnson, no run length ball, tapped back to the bowler
Root to Haddin, no run round the wicket, full and driven back into the ground, Cook fields on the bounce at straight midwicket
Root to Haddin, no run drifting across outside off and Haddin blocks
Root to Haddin, 2 runs touch short, on the legs and worked past orthodox midwicket for a couple into the deep
Root to Haddin, no run leg-stump line, played to straight midwicket
Root to Haddin, no run turns the wrists and taps a length ball into the leg side
Root to Haddin, no run on the stumps, poked back on the leg side - just a couple off the over
Swann to Johnson, no run round the wicket, pushed through and worked into the on side
Swann to Johnson, no run gets forward to defend on the front foot
Swann to Johnson, no run leans out and defends into the short cover region
Swann to Johnson, no run drifting towards middle and leg, turned into the leg side
Swann to Johnson, SIX runs Johnson continues to land punches on Swann, his eye is in and he waits for a juicy, tossed-up apple and then takes a big bite, bludgeoning the ball over long-on
Swann to Johnson, no run tossed up and defended on the off stump
Tremlett to Johnson, no run Johnson goes for the pull here but doesn't find the gap
Tremlett to Johnson, no run angling across Johnson, who pushes to mid-off
Tremlett to Johnson, no run left alone outside off
Tremlett to Johnson, no run pushed away defensively to the off side
Tremlett to Johnson, 1 run straighter from Tremlett, again he's not quite hitting the 130kph mark, and Johnson works it easily through midwicket
Tremlett to Haddin, 2 runs Haddin goes for another pull and gets this forward of midwicket, nice shot but Pietersen in the deep makes a sliding save and takes another chunk out of the turf
Swann to Johnson, 1 run and that's the century stand as Johnson drives down to long-off and they amble through for a single
Swann to Haddin, no run around the wicket to Haddin, who defends from middle stump
Swann to Haddin, no run leans forward to defend again
Swann to Haddin, 2 runs just outside off now and Haddin waits for a very late cut, just a dab past slip, really
Swann to Haddin, 1 run fullish ball doesn't have the chance to turn, Haddin drives along the ground to long-on
Swann to Johnson, no run over the wicket to Johnson, who goes back to defend
Broad to Haddin, 3 runs Haddin immediately wants to take advantage of the hard, new ball, drives hard at a fullish ball outside off and that flies in the air through extra cover
Broad to Johnson, no run perhaps a hint of inswing there for Broad, Johnson drives from an off-stump line to mid-on

Broad to Johnson, no run big appeal from Broad for lbw, but that one is immediately turned down and there's not even a conference between the England players, that's how they viewed that one. There was a big inside edge, but it was a good ball, full and swinging in
Broad to Johnson, no run again curling in to the left-hander, who drives to mid-on again
Broad to Johnson, 2 runs Johnson goes for it now, just a chip really, over square leg and it bounces away towards the boundary but is collected by fine leg running around
Broad to Johnson, no run this one goes the other way, lovely ball from Broad, and it beats the bat of Johnson
Anderson to Haddin, no run uppishly driven by Haddin, shouts of 'catch it' from England but this bounces well short of mid-off
Anderson to Haddin, 2 leg byes down leg side now and Haddin tickles it away past Prior for a couple of leg byes
Anderson to Haddin, no run Anderson probes outside off but Haddin won't allow himself to be probed, he leaves it alone
Anderson to Haddin, no run angling in straighter now and Haddin defends
Anderson to Haddin, no run pushed away towards point and no run for Haddin
Anderson to Haddin, no run Anderson draws Haddin out this time and beats the outside edge, that did not miss by much - Anderson bowling around 133kph
Broad to Johnson, FOUR runs full enough to drive and Johnson drives lavishly through cover, along the ground and so well timed, that's a beautiful shot
Broad to Johnson, no run tempted again but he shoulders arms this time
Broad to Johnson, no run stifled appeal now as Broad swings it in but this one is swinging down leg
Broad to Johnson, no run that's the way Broad might just get Johnson, swinging it in and then getting the odd one to move the other way - this one does just that and beats Johnson's outside edge
Broad to Johnson, no run full again and Johnson drives to mid-off, can't find the gap

Broad to Johnson, OUT Broad gets his fifth! That's the end of a terrific fighting partnership, and it ended thanks to the new ball and Stuart Broad's swing, he curves this one back in to the left-hander, Johnson tries to play straight but it nips between bat and pad and clobbers the middle stump.
Anderson to Haddin, FOUR runs edge from Haddin but this one runs safely wide of third slip and away to third man

Anderson to Haddin, FOUR runs classic off-drive here, Haddin has just given that the full face of the bat and slammed it straight down into the ground and away through mid-off, a little too full perhaps from Anderson
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run pushed away to cover for a quick single
Anderson to Siddle, 2 runs Siddle gets himself off the mark straight away with a nudge through cover for a couple
Anderson to Siddle, no run short of a length outside off and Siddle leaves it alone
Anderson to Siddle, no run solidly defended by Siddle, not much swing here for Anderson
Broad to Haddin, no run wrong line from Broad, this one sails down leg untouched by Haddin
Broad to Haddin, 1 run sends down a bouncer this time but it's not quick enough to threaten Haddin, who hooks safely to fine leg
Broad to Siddle, no run Broad is searching for the edge on off stump but Siddle defends
Broad to Siddle, no run beaten this time, comprehensively, as this one goes between bat and pad and through to Prior
Broad to Siddle, 1 run clipped away through leg, they think about two and then think better of it
Broad to Haddin, no run Broad again searching for the edge, Haddin defends to point
Anderson to Siddle, no run Anderson goes fullish just outside off, Siddle offers it the full face of the bat
Anderson to Siddle, no run some outswing now from Anderson and Siddle leaves it alone
Anderson to Siddle, no run good bowling, lovely outswing and late enough to draw Siddle in, there's a prod that very nearly results in an edge behind
Anderson to Siddle, no run straighter this time and Siddle works it to leg

Anderson to Siddle, FOUR runs Siddle is happy to play his shots when the opportunity arises, and he jumps on one that is just a touch short, pulling confidently through midwicket and it runs away to the boundary
Anderson to Siddle, no run beaten outside off, really lovely bowling from Anderson, it has just swung too much for Siddle
Tremlett to Haddin, no run left alone outside off first up
Tremlett to Haddin, 1 run clipped off the pads for a single to Trott at fine leg
Tremlett to Siddle, no run Tremlett attacks the stumps, Siddle defends them

Tremlett to Siddle, no run straight drive from Haddin and almost gets his partner into trouble, it ricochets off the outstretched right hand of Tremlett and almost back onto the stumps, I'm not sure if Siddle was back in his ground
Tremlett to Siddle, no run defended away safely to the off side
Tremlett to Siddle, no run short of a length and Siddle goes back to defend
Anderson to Haddin, no run Anderson probes outside off and it's defended comfortably by Haddin
Anderson to Haddin, no run thickish outside edge is collected off the bounce in the cordon
Anderson to Haddin, 1 leg bye swinging down the leg side and Haddin can't get much on that, just a bit of thigh
Anderson to Siddle, no run beaten outside off, Anderson is bowling some very handy deliveries here with the second new ball but just can't find the edge

Anderson to Siddle, OUT and there is the edge! Anderson deserved that, he had beaten Siddle a number of times and this one just moved a fraction away and Siddle's defensive push is collected low to the ground at first slip
Anderson to Harris, no run Harris gets a sighter outside off, he leaves it alone
Tremlett to Haddin, 1 run there's a Sharapova-like grunt from Tremlett as he bangs this one in, but his effort is to no avail - it doesn't get up much and is nudged away safely towards square leg
Tremlett to Harris, no run Tremlett gets some away swing now, at 131kph, but it is left safely alone

Tremlett to Harris, no run fullish outside off and this one beats the bat, which hits the ground as it passes the ball - England's cordon are mildly interested in an appeal, Tremlett not even mildly, and the umpire agrees with Tremlett
Tremlett to Harris, no run driven back towards the bowler
Tremlett to Harris, no run nudged away towards the off side
Tremlett to Harris, 2 runs expansive sort of a drive from Harris to get off the mark, through the off side

Anderson to Haddin, 3 runs more runs for Haddin late in the day, he's just leant on this one that was swinging down leg, and the timing is such that it races away through midwicket and he almost picks up a boundary
Anderson to Harris, no run beaten, comprehensively! Anderson gets one to straighten just ever so slightly, and Harris can't get bat on ball
Anderson to Harris, no run worked away to point and Harris can't find the gap

Anderson to Harris, 2 runs solid drive, really solid straight drive from Harris that is almost a low return chance to Anderson, but he was never really going to get it. The ball pulls up inside the rope but the batsmen only take two - Harris seems intent on protecting Haddin, as if he's a nightwatchman
Anderson to Harris, no run left alone outside off
Anderson to Harris, no run solid defence from Harris, and that's the end of the first day's play
Broad to Haddin, no run full and wide outside, hint of swing, left alone
Broad to Haddin, no run lets this through to the keeper, good carry to Prior
Broad to Haddin, 1 run back of a length, around off stump, nudged into the leg side in front of mid-on
Broad to Harris, 2 runs nice shot from Harris, punched off the back foot through the covers and the slow outfield keeps them to a couple
Broad to Harris, no run first bouncer of the day, over middle and leg, Harris ducks underneath
Broad to Harris, 2 runs full and angling into middle and leg, clipped away in front of square...confident start from Australia
Anderson to Haddin, no run full outside off, swing for Anderson, left alone
Anderson to Haddin, no run full outside off, Haddin across the crease and defending to the covers
Anderson to Haddin, no run firmly driven up to mid-off
Anderson to Haddin, no run pitched up at middle and off, defended back towards the bowler
Anderson to Haddin, no run shorter of length this time, Haddin stays back and defends to cover
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run gets squared up, he was shaping to play something expansive through the leg side, the outside edge squirts away through gully so he keeps the strike
Root to Haddin, 2 runs touch short, on leg stump and Haddin tucks this off his hips, races back for a second
Root to Haddin, no run skids through a little low, Haddin drops his bat on it in front of the stumps

Root to Haddin, 1 run stays back and nudges to midwicket, there's a note of panic in the call and Bell's throw isn't far from causing Johnson a mischief but they get the single and Brad Haddin goes to fifty in his 50th Test
Root to Johnson, no run angled in towards the off stump, Johnson shows it the maker's name
Root to Johnson, no run stays upright and defends as the ball skips on around off stump
Root to Johnson, no run darted in again from round the wicket and Johnson again defends stoutly
Swann to Haddin, 1 run fullish ball and it's driven back past the bowler
Swann to Johnson, no run Johnson plays back but can't find a run to short fine leg
Swann to Johnson, no run again Johnson goes back in his crease and defends
Swann to Johnson, no run flattish and straight, no real spin, and it's defended
Swann to Johnson, no run defended away to the off side
Broad to Haddin, no run sharp bouncer, outside off, Haddin responds by trying to pull but gets beaten over the top edge trying to fetch it
Broad to Haddin, 1 run that's a poor delivery, short and wide, Haddin frees his arms through the off side but Carberry is sweeping on the cover boundary
Broad to Harris, 1 run stand and deliver, Harris drives on the up, Anderson gets across from mid-off and dives, again jarring his knee on the outfield
Broad to Haddin, 1 run full at off stump, pushed firmly into the off-side gap
Broad to Harris, no run full at the stumps, punched firmly to mid-on
Broad to Harris, OUT six for Broad...all rather casual. Harris tries to leave a length delivery outside, can't get his bat out of the line fast enough and the ball runs off the back to Prior
Anderson to Haddin, 3 runs steps away to leg, gives himself room, then flays a back-of-a-length delivery through the off side...excellent work from Carberry on the rope to prevent the boundary
Anderson to Lyon, no run solidly behind the line on off stump, defended back past Anderson
Anderson to Lyon, no run bouncer over off stump, Lyon gets underneath it
Anderson to Lyon, no run full delivery, think inside edge into his pad as he tries to flick it through the leg side
Anderson to Lyon, no run another short one, this one gives Lyon a glancing blow on the shoulder/back and loops through to Prior
Anderson to Lyon, no run well played by Lyon, blocks a full delivery up to mid-off
Tremlett to Haddin, FOUR runs lovely shot, Haddin drives this straight back past Tremlett - who has replaced Root - and it runs away to the long-off boundary, so well timed
Tremlett to Haddin, no run defended safely this time
Tremlett to Haddin, no run gets in behind this one to defend again
Tremlett to Haddin, no run probing outside off but no sideways movement and Haddin defends
Tremlett to Haddin, no run once again Haddin defends
Tremlett to Haddin, no run not exactly express pace from Tremlett, 126.6kph that clocked at, he's perhaps tiring at the end of the day, and Haddin again defends
Swann to Johnson, no run drifting in and straightening off the pitch, Johnson defends
Swann to Johnson, no run flighted on the pads, Johnson bunts it away, happy to wait for his fifty
Swann to Johnson, no run he wants the single now, nudges one to square leg and takes off but is turned back, nearly slips over on the pitch but all's well that ends well
Swann to Johnson, no run a little shorter from Swann but Johnson's cut can't find the gap

Swann to Johnson, FOUR runs that is the fifty for Mitchell Johnson, and quite a way to bring it up, he has just lofted this beautifully over cover, a well-controlled shot really and it bounces safely away for four
Swann to Johnson, 3 runs rocks back to a shorter ball and adds more runs now as he cuts this behind point
Broad to Haddin, no run backs away to leg, doesn't make contact as he aims through the off side again
Broad to Haddin, 1 run fuller outside off, inside edge into his pad and it bobbles towards the slips...happy to expose Lyon
Broad to Lyon, 1 run he's off the mark, Broad will be annoyed as he strays too straight and Lyon flicks him to fine leg
Broad to Haddin, 1 run short of a length, dropped square of the wicket into the off side
Broad to Lyon, no run short of a length, Lyon doesn't have a problem blocking this to the off side
Broad to Lyon, no run good carry through to Prior, Lyon played it well, dropping his hands as the ball zipped from short of a length
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run again he takes the single, driving a full delivery towards deepish cover
Anderson to Lyon, no run confident from Lyon, onto the front foot and drives to mid-off
Anderson to Lyon, no run outside off, a little movement away, left alone
Anderson to Lyon, no run goes very full, perhaps aiming for the yorker, it's well dug out towards the off side
Anderson to Lyon, no run big appeal for a glove to the keeper as Lyon drops his hands, but England opt not to the review...may have brushed the back arm
Anderson to Lyon, no run well played, short of a length, sharp delivery, but he hops into line and defends to the on side
Broad to Haddin, FOUR runs cracking shot from Haddin, short ball and he disdainfully pulls it through straight midwicket...he saw that very early
Broad to Haddin, no run this is shorter and a touch quicker, Haddin tries a repeat shot and is beaten this time
Broad to Haddin, 1 run short again, outside off, cuts in front of square to deep cover
Broad to Lyon, no run full outside off, left alone, Prior takes by his boots
Broad to Lyon, no run beats the outside edge, short of a length and it rises past Lyon who pulled his bat away but was beaten
Broad to Lyon, no run that's an excellent short ball, 85mph/136kph, and Lyon flinches as he gets out of the line

Anderson to Haddin, 1 run, OUT he's gone! Excellent from Carberry. Haddin jabbed a full ball into the off side and wanted two, but he never had a chance once Carberry picked up the ball cleanly running in from deep point. It was an okay throw, a slightly awkward take from Prior who did very well to get the ball down onto the

The England openers race off straight away, followed by the rest, and Broad raises the ball to the crowd again. A few more boos. It has been a superb performance from him. England will be delighted to keep Australia under 300, although 295 is a few more than looked likely at 132 for 6. Now it's all about the new ball again. Harris,
The Australians coming back out. Cook and Carberry will follow shortly. Huge moment for Carberry, his second, belated chance at Test cricket. This should be a testing period up to lunch.
Ryan Harris with the first over. So we have to wait for Mitchell...
Harris to Cook, 1 leg bye short of a length on leg stump, glances off Cook's thigh pad down to fine leg
Harris to Carberry, 2 runs he's off the mark neatly with a clip through the leg side, was a length delivery around middle and leg, that will calm him down
Harris to Carberry, 2 runs full at off stump, hint of swing back in, but it's meant with a solid punch straight down the ground, bounces into the hard pitch then bisects mid-on and mid-off
Harris to Carberry, no run short of a length outside off, climbs through to Haddin as Carberry pulls his bat inside the line
Harris to Carberry, 1 run on leg stump, 91mph/146kph (that's notable), and it's flicked down to fine leg
Harris to Cook, no run good delivery, full on off stump, shaping back a little and Cook is a little hurried as he defends
Johnson to Carberry, no run starts with a full toss down the leg side, Carberry doesn't make contact, it was 90mph/144kph
Johnson to Carberry, no run gets the line right, at off stump, full length, Carberry defends
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run full outside leg again, Carberry flicks it down to fine leg
Johnson to Cook, no run full at middle and off, 90mph/144kph again, dug out into midwicket
Johnson to Cook, 2 runs very full at leg stump, flicked past short leg and wide of long leg for a brace to get off the mark
Johnson to Cook, no run dragged down a touch short and wide, 91mph/146mph, outside off and left alone
Harris to Carberry, no run full, going across outside off, Carberry keeps his bat tight to his pad as and watches the ball go through
Harris to Carberry, no run a fraction shorter, left alone, Haddin takes it on the rise
Harris to Carberry, no run gets a small stride forward, defends to the off side
Harris to Carberry, no run wide enough to leave alone again
Harris to Carberry, no run fuller and outside off again, Michael Clarke claps as that one goes through to Haddin
Harris to Carberry, no run on off stump, defended to cover, to end a steady maiden
Johnson to Cook, no run on a length outside off, defended to the cover...Johnson has some stunning facial hair going on at the moment (that, obviously, has nothing to do with the actual delivery)
Johnson to Cook, no run a little fuller this time, Cook's stride isn't very big as he defends to the off side
Johnson to Cook, FOUR runs on leg stump, clipped very fine past the keeper for the first boundary of the innings...wonder if Clarke will consider a leg slip?
Johnson to Cook, no run goes for the yorker, comes out a low full toss, Cook bunts it to mid-on
Johnson to Cook, no run that's a good line and length, on off stump, Cook defends and it runs off the outside edge towards gully
Johnson to Cook, FOUR runs dropped in short, Cook responds with a powerful pull, in the air in over midwicket, and despite the slow outfield it creeps into the boundary rope
Harris to Carberry, no run back of a length, wide outside off, left alone
Harris to Carberry, 1 run tucks this past short leg
Harris to Cook, no run on middle and leg, defended towards midwicket
Harris to Cook, no run solidly defended to mid-off
Harris to Cook, no run much fuller this time, trying to tempt the drive that was his downfall in England a few times, and it's left alone
Harris to Cook, no run left alone again
Johnson to Carberry, no run back of a length and searing through, quick and bouncy and totally ignored by Carberry
Johnson to Carberry, no run fuller, just outside the line of off, Carberry leans out and carefully defends on the front foot
Johnson to Carberry, no run on the stumps, tapped defensively down towards leg

Johnson to Carberry, no run woof, that's some MJ magic right there, signs of that mercurial swing as the ball curves late away from the batsman, who wasn't forward and poked in vain - not far off getting a snick on it
Johnson to Carberry, no run dug in short and this sails down the leg side, no shot offered

Johnson to Carberry, FOUR runs width, Carberry flashes hard and the ball flies off the outer half of the bat, it flew over the cordon, I think, but there were plenty of juice in it, deliberately played and the ball zips to the rope
Harris to Cook, no run length delivery sliding across the left-hander, who leans out but is happy to leave
Harris to Cook, no run good, probing line outside off, again Cook lets it through
Harris to Cook, no run this skips up off the pitch, outside off and Cook jerks his hands out of the way as the ball flies through to Haddin
Harris to Cook, no run in the channel, defended on the front foot
Harris to Cook, no run that's a well-judged leave, Harris aiming for the top of off but Cook shoulders arms, knowing it will probably bounce over anyway
Harris to Cook, 2 runs touch too full and on the pads, Cook likes it there, oooh, yeah, just there, ooh, that feels good... picks up a couple through midwicket
Siddle to Carberry, no run slightly back of a length, down the leg side and left alone
Siddle to Carberry, no run angled across from over the wicket and then holding its line, Carberry still happy to leave
Siddle to Carberry, no run on the stumps, comes forward to defend
Siddle to Carberry, no run there's that extra bounce, a little encouragement for Australia's Banana Man, Siddle's delivery spitting off a length and hitting up near the splice
Siddle to Carberry, 2 runs on the pads, Carberry crabs his way across his stumps and clips two more through midwicket
Siddle to Carberry, no run in the corridor of uncertainty, Carberry is certainly not going to play, though
Harris to Cook, no run good pace and carry from Harris, but wide enough for Cook to ignore
Harris to Cook, no run tighter, forcing Cook to play and he jabs the ball defensively towards backward point
Harris to Cook, no run good length, around off stump, steered square on the off side
Harris to Cook, no run super take from Haddin, rare swing for Harris as the ball bent past Cook's attempted leg glance, the keeper plunging to his right to make a one-handed catch
Harris to Cook, no run slightly full, again looking for that killer curve on the ball, it does shape back a touch outside off but Cook is confident in leaving once more
Harris to Cook, no run on the stumps, presses forward and defends to mid-on
Siddle to Carberry, 1 run leg-stump line and Carberry nudges a single in front of square off his pads
Siddle to Cook, 1 run shortish, on the body, pushed in front of a sprawling midwicket and there's another quick single
Siddle to Carberry, no run pitched up around middle and off, comes forward to defend
Siddle to Carberry, no run full of a length, in the channel outside off, lets it through
Siddle to Carberry, no run good length delivery, on the stumps and again blocked half-forward
Siddle to Carberry, no run down the leg side, not quite where Siddle wants it but Carberry swishes and misses
Harris to Cook, no run outside off, pushed through and left alone

Harris to Cook, OUT probing outside off, Cook is drawn into playing and there's a visible deflection through to Haddin - Australia have the breakthrough they needed! Harris, into his sixth over, has been immaculate as ever and he gets Cook again, reward for his persistence. The delivery maybe nibbled away a touch off the sea
Harris to Trott, no run dug in short, goes for the bouncer barrage straight away, Trott jerks his head out of the way
Harris to Trott, no run fuller length, on the stumps and worked to leg
Harris to Trott, no run comes forward, pushes a length ball into the covers
Harris to Trott, FOUR runs Trott is up and running, too full and straight from Harris and the ball is whipped forcefully through midwicket for a boundary
Johnson to Carberry, no run a bit like his first delivery earlier this morning, a swinging yorker down the leg side
Johnson to Carberry, FOUR runs too full again, on the pads and all Carberry needs to do is get a scrape of bat on it to send the ball fine to the rope
Johnson to Carberry, no run gets across and in line to defend around off
Johnson to Carberry, 2 runs fullish, outside off, this doesn't swing and Carberry picks off another brace on the drive
Johnson to Carberry, no run chin music from Johnson, though it's wide enough outside off that Carberry's crouch is mainly for show
Johnson to Carberry, no run another steamy bumper in the channel outside off, nothing doing
Harris to Trott, no run shortish, Trott goes back and across to defend
Harris to Trott, no run on the stumps, worked off the pads but straight to midwicket
Harris to Trott, no run in the corridor outside off stump, not doing a great deal off the straight but Trott watches it by
Harris to Trott, no run walks across and shoulders arms to another length ball in the channel
Harris to Trott, no run disciplined line and length from Harris, no freebies - which was pretty much England's strategy - and Trott leaves once more
Johnson to Carberry, no run another bouncer, wide of the stumps, Carberry genuflects as it passes him

Johnson to Carberry, FOUR runs straighter line, short and at the ribs and Carberry fends it round the corner, it's not miles away form being a chance to Haddin but the ball skips away to the fine-leg boundary
Johnson to Carberry, no run short and sharp, causing the batsman to flinch out of the way - that was 91mph/145kph
Johnson to Carberry, no run pitched up further, Carberry gets himself in order to defend back down the wicket
Johnson to Carberry, no run back of a length and left alone outside off
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run length ball, a little straight and Carberry clips the ball low and wide of the catcher for a single to long leg
Siddle to Carberry, no run good line and length outside off, no stroke offered

Siddle to Carberry, no run Carberry is tempted into attempting a wild thrash off the back foot, the ball was too close to him for the shot, though and the play-and-miss draws a gurgle of approval from the Gabba bleachers
Siddle to Carberry, 2 runs down the leg side and worked off Carberry's sizable trunk for a couple more
Siddle to Carberry, no run pushed across the left-hander, Carberry lets it through to the keeper
Siddle to Carberry, no run straighter, tries to play across the line and a low leading edge runs back down the pitch to the bowler
Siddle to Carberry, no run in the channel and Carberry draws his bat inside the line

Johnson to Trott, no run and whammo! hit on the gloves first ball fending at a skiddy bumper, Johnson has a glare on, staring down the wicket, after Trott awkwardly hopped back and thrust his hands up in front of his face - did well to keep it down
Johnson to Trott, 3 runs shortish and at the body again, Trott plays this well, going across his stumps and flicking the ball high over backward square, they pick up three
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run drifts towards the leg side again, nudged round the corner for one more
Johnson to Trott, no run dug in, Trott's block is on the chopper again, he ducks and weaves out of the way
Johnson to Trott, 2 runs Trott plays this well enough, keeping on top of the bounce and paddling a couple through square leg - that posts the England fifty, too
Johnson to Trott, no run quick and on a good length but down the leg side and left
Siddle to Carberry, no run full of a length, holding its line outside off, watchfully left alone by Carberry

Siddle to Carberry, 3 runs edged but Carberry manages to keep on top of it, the ball travelling at speed through gully - Siddle again getting some extra vim out of the surface, though it slows down before the rope
Siddle to Trott, no run energetic stuff from P Siddy, in the channel outside off, Trott walks past it
Siddle to Trott, no run good, tight line, blocked square on the off side
Siddle to Trott, 1 run Siddle holds his hands to his head as Trott walks in front of his stumps and scoops one to fine leg
Siddle to Carberry, no run length delivery, another calm leave from Carberry

Johnson to Trott, OUT short and down the leg side, Trott plays away from his body and Haddin goes up in celebration - they've got him, Johnson has done it, on the stroke of lunch! Just as England did yesterday, Australia have plucked out the No. 3 just as the napkins were being laid out. Clarke in the slips wasn't sure but H
Johnson to Pietersen, no run excellent delivery, short on leg stump, Pietersen jumps in the air to defend and takes his bottom hand off the bat as he fends it away to the leg side...no short leg
Johnson to Pietersen, no run quick! 91mph/146kph, short and it beats Pietersen's instinctive attempt to pull it away
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run back of a length on off stump, calmly pushed into the off side to get him off the mark. No red bull run today
Johnson to Carberry, no run short, over leg stump, Carberry goes underneath it...92.5mph/149kph
Johnson to Carberry, no run ends with another bouncer, a little straighter this time, the impressive Carberry is easily ducking away
Siddle to Pietersen, no run full on middle and off, defended to midwicket
Siddle to Pietersen, no run very full outside off, hint of swing, Pietersen drives but only gets a toe-end into the covers
Siddle to Pietersen, no run full outside off, left alone
Siddle to Pietersen, no run closer to off stump, Pietersen judges it and lifts the bat high above his head
Siddle to Pietersen, no run gets a stride across and forward, then defends at the top of the bounce to the off side
Siddle to Pietersen, no run wider and shorter outside off, left alone
Johnson to Carberry, no run back of a length on off stump, he's behind the line defending
Johnson to Carberry, no run fuller, outside off, left alone
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run gets across his crease to a length ball and tucks it into midwicket
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full outside off stump, Pietersen ends up playing this standing outside off into the covers
Johnson to Pietersen, no run stands tall and punches this off the back foot down to mid-off
Johnson to Pietersen, FOUR runs threads the gap, short ball on leg stump and he flamboyantly pulls it between deep square and long leg
Siddle to Carberry, no run full and wide outside off, left alone...Carberry's judgement has been very impressive (although this was an easy leave)
Siddle to Carberry, no run closer to off stump, but Carberry can still leave it alone
Siddle to Carberry, no run that's a good one, he might have beaten Carberry this time with a ball in the channel outside off although the left hander pulled the bat way at the last moment
Siddle to Carberry, no run finds a thick outside edge with a length delivery, but it's played down in front of third slip with reasonably soft hands
Siddle to Carberry, no run terrific delivery, a yorker, Carberry manages to jab down to keep it out...for a moment Clarke ponders a review thinking it was pad first
Siddle to Carberry, no run wide outside off, another maiden for Siddle
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run short on leg stump, similar to the Trott dismissal, and Pietersen is off the ground when he flicks it down to long leg
Johnson to Carberry, no run flung outside off stump, left alone
Johnson to Carberry, no run back of a length at off stump, defended to midwicket
Johnson to Carberry, FOUR runs that's an edge, but a controlled one (Dan, you agree?) as he plays forward and plays with soft hands again which takes it between third and gully
Johnson to Carberry, no run short, he ducks underneath...pace still good from Johnson
Johnson to Carberry, no run defended to midwicket
Siddle to Pietersen, no run outside off, left alone
Siddle to Pietersen, no run that's a probing line and length, full outside off, meant with a big stride forward by Pietersen
Siddle to Pietersen, no run drives at a full delivery, comes slightly across the line and it skews out to point
Siddle to Pietersen, no run gets right across his stumps again and flicks this from around off stump to mid-on
Siddle to Pietersen, no run a flowing drive but he slots it straight to mid-off
Siddle to Pietersen, no run back of a length outside off, left alone
Harris to Carberry, no run down the leg side
Harris to Carberry, no run that's the line, outside off but not too wide, Carberry hides the bat behind the pad
Harris to Carberry, no run very full, on the popping crease, left alone
Harris to Carberry, no run full outside off, Carberry not tempted
Harris to Carberry, no run not quite so full, but outside off again and left again
Harris to Carberry, 2 runs he loses his line this time, on leg stump, neatly clipped away in front of square and it slows up over the outfield
Siddle to Pietersen, no run appears Australia have into a bit of a holding pattern now, outside off and KP doesn't play
Siddle to Pietersen, 2 runs full and straight, flicked through midwicket without much power

Siddle to Pietersen, no run dropped by Siddle! What a moment that could be! A full delivery, Pietersen was early on his shot and it was a comfortable height for Siddle in his follow through. Major let-off
Siddle to Pietersen, no run full at middle, a punchy drive to mid-on
Siddle to Pietersen, no run forward and driving again, this time it's outside off and Pietersen finds mid-off
Siddle to Pietersen, no run banged in very short outside off
Harris to Carberry, no run neat delivery, good judgement, full outside off, shaping back and left alone
Harris to Carberry, 1 run defended square into the off side, point is behind square so it's an easy single
Harris to Pietersen, 3 runs angled into the pads, flicked strong in front of square but doesn't have the power to reach the boundary
Harris to Carberry, no run back of a length at off stump, Carberry jumps behind the line to defend
Harris to Carberry, no run lets this one go through
Harris to Carberry, no run pushed wider outside off, another leave alone
Siddle to Pietersen, 1 run full at middle, flicked through midwicket who ambles to the other end
Siddle to Carberry, no run keeps it outside off, Carberry keeps letting it through
Siddle to Carberry, no run gets half forward and defends to point (is half forward like half a hole? One to ponder)
Siddle to Carberry, no run back of a length, dangling it outside the stumps and Carberry happy to let it by
Siddle to Carberry, no run pushed fuller and wider, ignored
Siddle to Carberry, no run makes him play to end the over, goes to cover
Harris to Pietersen, 2 runs on leg stump, easy for Pietersen to clip this behind square
Harris to Pietersen, no run sweetly struck on-drive, mid-on is quite straight like England have for Watson
Harris to Pietersen, no run defends on the walk into the off side
Harris to Pietersen, 2 runs full on off stump, comes forward and gets a thick inside edge down to long leg

Harris to Pietersen, 1 run sharp single as Pietersen works it towards mid-on...KP was safe, but Carberry was a little slow and a direct hit would have been very close! Blimey, that would have been lazy
Harris to Carberry, no run on off stump, defended to the covers
Siddle to Pietersen, no run good delivery, close to off stump and it's a well-judged leave

Siddle to Pietersen, 1 run direct hit...but Carberry is declared safe by Dar at square leg. Warner strikes the strikers' end from backward point after Pietersen played the ball square. Well, well...that was very close. Was Carberry's bat in the air. His foot was just in.
Siddle to Carberry, 1 run worked into the leg side
Siddle to Pietersen, no run full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
Siddle to Pietersen, no run there's a tempter from Siddle, pushed full and wide, Pietersen goes for the drive but is flat-footed and gets no timing
Lyon to Carberry, no run round the wicket, on middle and leg, defended
Lyon to Carberry, no run hint of turn as this one straightens on Carberry who blocks
Lyon to Carberry, no run pushed into the off side
Lyon to Carberry, no run and he fields this as Carberry defends
Lyon to Carberry, no run short delivery and it spins past Carberry's outside ...nice delivery
Lyon to Carberry, no run now that's a ripper! Tossed up fuller, it spins again and Carberry his well beaten as he plays forward. Lovely stuff.
Harris to Pietersen, no run back of a length at off stump, defended to mid-off
Harris to Pietersen, no run big stride forward and thudded to mid-off
Harris to Pietersen, no run left alone outside off
Harris to Pietersen, no run shaping away wide outside off, I suspect Pietersen considered having a dip before leaving well alone
Harris to Pietersen, no run gets across the crease and works this down to mid-on, the ball was outside off

Harris to Pietersen, OUT gone! Massive moment. Pietersen has clipped it straight to midwicket. Australia have thought they can get Pietersen that way. It was full on middle, it came right out of the screws, but straight to George Bailey. Australia nudge their noses in front
Lyon to Carberry, no run tossed up around off stump, Carberry leans out and plays back to the bowler
Lyon to Carberry, no run flighted, spinning outside the line of off, lets this one through
Lyon to Carberry, no run a little wider, in the channel, smothers the turn in defence
Lyon to Carberry, no run more bounce for Lyon, driven into the covers off the back foot
Lyon to Carberry, no run tossed up wide of the stumps, dip and turn but no stroke offered this time
Lyon to Carberry, no run pushes this one through in the corridor, again left alone
Harris to Bell, no run length delivery outside off, comes forward and blocks with soft hands
Harris to Bell, no run slightly wide of the stumps, happy to let this one through to the keeper
Harris to Bell, no run continues to deliver a testing line outside the off peg, Bell watchful but offers no stroke
Harris to Bell, no run shoulders arms, the ball again zipping through
Harris to Bell, 2 runs flicked off the pads and in the air again, albeit briefly, the ball skittering past midwicket and away for Bell's first runs
Harris to Bell, no run gets behind the line and defends, with head bowed, back down the track
Lyon to Carberry, no run tossed up on an off-stump line, defended into the off side
Lyon to Carberry, no run this comes off the outer half of the bat as Carberry prods at it, running low past silly point
Lyon to Carberry, no run attempts some aggression to Lyon, who has dictated terms to far, but a back-foot force can't beat extra cover
Lyon to Carberry, no run floated up in the channel, again Carberry gets his bat in line to block
Lyon to Carberry, no run Carberry is on the front foot to push defensively towards silly point again

Lyon to Carberry, no run length ball, straightening and bouncing, drops back and punches into the covers but again there's no run - three maidens in a row for Lyon, just the sort of control his captain wants
Johnson to Bell, no run length ball slanted across the right-hander from over the wicket, Bell raises his bat to the sky
Johnson to Bell, 1 run pushed across, looking to induce a moment's indecision - and indiscretion - outside off, but Bell dabs the ball daintily into the covers and steals a base
Johnson to Carberry, no run fullish, wide of the stumps and ignored by the batsman
Johnson to Carberry, no run lovely ball from Johnson, full and swerving late past the outside edge, Carberry drew his bat inside but he'd already been beaten
Johnson to Carberry, no run pitched up, well outside off, this is up above 90mph again but left alone
Johnson to Carberry, no run gets forward outside off and watches another one through
Lyon to Bell, no run round the wicket from Lyon, drifting across and defended into the on side
Lyon to Bell, no run tossed up a little higher, Bell comes a long way forward to intercept the danger
Lyon to Bell, 2 runs pushed flatter and a little wide, Bell is quick to go back this time and chop a couple in front of point
Lyon to Bell, no run tossed up around off, defended on the front foot
Lyon to Bell, no run comes forward and drives this time, towards mid-off
Lyon to Bell, no run floated up around off stump, Bell gets in line to tap back down the track
Johnson to Carberry, no run thudded in short and the ball deflects away, behind short leg, who scrambles in pursuit - looks like it careened into Carberry's ribs, rather than took the glove
Johnson to Carberry, no run another bumper, this time Carberry takes it on ... but hooks and misses at a sharply rising ball

Johnson to Carberry, OUT short, speared across and takes the edge, he's gone, Johnson does it again! Superbly planned and executed by Australia, Carberry was clearly discomfited by that line of attack, Johnson beating out a tattoo of short deliveries that rose towards the ribcage, this slid across and although he tried to wi

Johnson to Root, no run the field was set for another short ball, Johnson going back over the wicket, but it was instead full, Root dropped the bat and was only a whisker from getting something on it, sound of bat on ground, I think
Johnson to Root, no run pitched up again, angled across, Root opens the face and pokes the ball to point
Johnson to Root, no run touch wider, gets forward and leaves
Lyon to Bell, no run full and flighred, gets forward to defend

Lyon to Bell, OUT spin and bounce, is there a little bit of glove as it pops to short leg? Yes, there is! Bell is gone, Lyon roars in delight, this trampolined off the surface as the batsman went back, the ball hit thigh pad and just a tickle of bat/glove, straight into the hands of the close catcher! The Gabba's grisly magi

Lyon to Prior, OUT and is that another? Prior lobs the ball to short leg - or does he? Smith took it again at short leg, throwing himself to his right, but Dar wasn't convinced. Australia review after a brief discussion and it looks like a brilliant decision, as replays show the ball coming off the inside edge on to pad. Sup
Lyon to Broad, no run tossed up, very wide off the stumps and Broad gratefully watches it spin and spit further away from him
Lyon to Broad, no run this is better, floated up on the stumps, Broad drops the bat on it solidly
Lyon to Broad, no run full and around the line of off, again Broad gets in line to defend
Johnson to Root, 2 runs driven into a gap, Root is off the mark and a misfield gives him a second
Johnson to Root, no run tighter line, defended in front of the stumps
Johnson to Root, no run shorter, goes back and defends from the crease

Johnson to Root, OUT full and wide, Root drives, huge edge and another one falls! England are in tatters, seven down, all their batsmen back in the coop! What was Root doing there?! It was pitched up, leaving him and he threw the bat, a loose drive, steering the ball into the midriff of third slip, Smith again. Australia in
Johnson to Swann, no run thumped hard into the deck, Swann dips his head out of the way of a bumper
Johnson to Swann, no run length ball, leaping at 91mph/145kph outside off, Swann drops his hands in the nick of time
Lyon to Broad, 2 runs more gasps as Broad pushes forwards, a thick edge scoots low past slip, they pick up a couple
Lyon to Broad, no run frees the arms and drives, can't beat the fielder in the covers
Lyon to Broad, no run tossed up, drifting towards leg stump, turned away
Lyon to Broad, no run opens the face and the ball again grips, takes the outer half of the bat towards backward point
Lyon to Broad, no run tossed up on off stump, big stride and a solid block from Broad
Lyon to Broad, no run very wide, the ball scuttles through as Broad shoulders arms in exaggerated fashion
Johnson to Swann, no run back of a length, the cordon watches greedily, Swann edges away
Johnson to Swann, no run banged in, down the leg side, this time he ducks

Johnson to Swann, OUT gone! Amazing, incredible scenes at the Gabba, England eight down! This is becoming a collapse for the ages, Swann the latest to be swallowed up, Johnson again the tormentor. He was hanging back for the short ball, this was on a length, on leg stump, he wasn't forward and an inside edge ballooned off th
Johnson to Tremlett, no run full and wide of the stumps, leaves this well alone
Johnson to Tremlett, no run fired across again, slightly back of a length, Tremlett shoulders arms again
Johnson to Tremlett, no run waspish, lifting off a length and thudding into the splice, the ball squirms wide of silly point and Tremlett survives
Lyon to Broad, 1 run Broad forces the ball into a gap on the off side and scampers a single
Lyon to Tremlett, no run gets forward on and defends the ball down the track
Lyon to Tremlett, 1 run tossed up, again Tremlett moves forward and pushes one past the bowler to get off the mark
Lyon to Broad, 1 run gives this some air, leans out and punches another single through mid-off
Lyon to Tremlett, no run flighted, straightening on the stumps, Tremlett gets a leading edge short on the off side
Lyon to Tremlett, no run tossed up, goes back and defends in front of off stump - and that, incredibly, brings us to tea, with England clinging on by a thread
Johnson to Broad, no run round the wicket, well-directed bouncer over off stump and Broad has to be sharp to get his gloves out of the way
Johnson to Broad, 1 run short on the hip, flicked down to long leg
Johnson to Tremlett, FOUR runs awkward again, short and Tremlett fends it away down the leg side off the glove...not far from Haddin
Johnson to Tremlett, no run banged in at the body, Tremlett stands tall (or just stands) as he defends down in front of short leg
Johnson to Tremlett, no run that's short and quick, clears Tremlett's head by a long way which is quite some effort
Johnson to Tremlett, no run short of a length, Tremlett not completely in line as it fizzes past the outside edge. Wonderful stuff from Johnson. A epic spell
Harris to Broad, 1 run more short stuff, from round the wicket, Broad is far from convincing as he flaps and it, the ball flies wide of short leg
Harris to Tremlett, no run stays round the wicket, Tremlett gets taken on the glove as he fends at a short ball in front of his face
Harris to Tremlett, no run fuller and outside off, left alone
Harris to Tremlett, no run stands and plays this with the bat, falls in front of short leg off the face
Harris to Tremlett, no run another one flying past the outside edge
Harris to Tremlett, no run left alone outside off
Johnson to Broad, no run jumps across his crease, it's a short ball outside leg, he flicks at it but doesn't make contact...Broad finished outside off stump
Johnson to Broad, FOUR runs short again, outside leg stump, makes connection this time and flicks it about where leg slip would have been
Johnson to Broad, 2 runs pushed across outside off, Broad drives from the back foot through the huge gap at cover...punchy stroke, but the two batsmen nearly run into each other
Johnson to Broad, no run 90mph/144kph, he's right across outside off, again, to a ball pitching in Johnson's half and aims another flick, but the delivery flies to Haddin
Johnson to Broad, no run he's taken a blow! Fierce delivery. Takes him on the back of the helmet, although the ball brushed the wrist first. This is hostile
Johnson to Broad, no run does well this time, gets behind the line and defends to the off side
Harris to Tremlett, no run still around the wicket, back of a length on off stump, defended to cover
Harris to Tremlett, 2 runs flicks into the leg side, zings off the face of the bat just past Bailey at short leg
Harris to Tremlett, no run short outside off, left alone
Harris to Tremlett, no run another short one, Tremlett ducks
Harris to Tremlett, no run outside off, through to Haddin
Harris to Tremlett, no run back of a length, defended to the off side
Johnson to Broad, 1 run short from round the wicket, Broad rides the bounce and blocks into the off side
Johnson to Tremlett, no run a rare full delivery, yorker on off stump, dug out to the off side
Johnson to Tremlett, no run short over leg stump, through to the keeper
Johnson to Tremlett, 1 run finds the edge, it was short of a length, thick edge but short of third slip and it escapes towards third man
Johnson to Broad, no run round the wicket, goes for the leg stump yorker - clever stuff - and it's not far from the timber as it shoots past Broad's pads
Johnson to Broad, no run defended into the off side
Harris to Tremlett, no run defended to the off side
Harris to Anderson, no run round the wicket, full, Anderson gets an inside edge into his pads
Harris to Anderson, no run short of a length, defended down the pitch
Harris to Anderson, no run gets forward to a fuller one, defended towards short leg
Harris to Anderson, 4 byes this bouncer is somewhat astray, evades Haddin and shoots away for four byes
Johnson to Broad, no run round the wicket, pushed outside off, Broad shuffles across and plays to cover
Johnson to Broad, no run gives himself room outside leg, aims to pull a bouncer through square leg but only connects with fresh air
Johnson to Broad, no run fuller this time, but still back of a length, defended to point

Johnson to Broad, 2 runs over the wicket now, full at off stump, Broad is caught on the crease as he drives and the ball comes off a thick inner part of the bat through square leg...as to dive completing the second run
Johnson to Broad, no run boy, this has been a world-class spell of hostile stuff, Broad fends at other one in front of his face
Johnson to Broad, 1 leg bye slips a full one down the leg side, takes the pad to fine leg
Lyon to Broad, no run full from round the wicket, driven back to the bowler
Lyon to Broad, 2 runs lap-sweeps this from outside off down to long leg
Lyon to Broad, no run nice line outside off, draws Broad forward and he pushed to point
Lyon to Broad, 2 runs dragged down a touch short, Broad rocks back and drives into the off side...cover is quite deep
Lyon to Broad, 1 run gets down early to sweep and fetches it from outside off to deep square
Lyon to Anderson, no run wide outside off, left alone
Siddle to Broad, FOUR runs hammered away, Broad crunches a short ball over the leg side
Siddle to Broad, no run short again, but slower this time, 82mph/131kph, Broad is through his shot too early
Siddle to Broad, 1 run short of a length at leg stump, flicked backward of square
Siddle to Anderson, no run now Anderson cops one on the gloves, a perfectly-directed short ball at the ribs and it smashes into the hand as it comes off the bat
Siddle to Anderson, no run flicks at this on the back foot, goes into the leg side
Siddle to Anderson, no run short and down the leg side, Anderson plays at it but no touch

Lyon to Broad, 2 runs nicely driven off the back foot through the off side, but Anderson has to get a move on then dive to complete the second. If Lyon had taken the ball at the stumps that would have been close
Lyon to Broad, no run touch short, driven off the back foot to cover
Lyon to Broad, no run nicely bowler, slower and fuller, it turns a touch as Broad prods to the off side
Lyon to Broad, 1 run whips this off the back foot through midwicket
Lyon to Anderson, no run beats the outside edge with a nicely flighted delivery
Lyon to Anderson, 2 runs gives him some width and Anderson drives it with square with some flourish through point
Siddle to Broad, no run short outside off, Broad aims square through off side but is beaten
Siddle to Broad, FOUR runs brings out the pull again, connects well and bisects deep square and long leg...more of a swat, really
Siddle to Broad, no run short of a length on off stump, defended

What an innings that was. At 82 for 2 it seemed pretty steady, then the hostile brilliance of Johnson, the canny spin of Lyon, the smart captaincy of Clarke and some batting that verged in the inept at times has led to this. Australia lead by 159 and there are 25 overs, light permitting, left today. Will be interesting to see who E
Innings Start
Slip, gully and a short leg in place. No silly point
